title: Installing BioShock 2 Remastered HD Texture Pack via TFC Installer in Wine
context: User on KDE Neon 24.04 used Wine to install and configure the Unreal 2/3 TFC Installer, applying the HD Texture Pack mod for BioShock 2 Remastered through both Wine GUI and shell automation.
keyIdea: A Wine-based TFC Installer setup can apply HD texture mods by combining .NET runtime installation, prefix management, and direct file operations that modify the game’s data directory used by Steam.
commands:
# Initialize Wine prefix
export WINEPREFIX=$HOME/.wine-tfc
wineboot --init
winetricks -q corefonts vcrun2019

# Install .NET 6 runtime under Wine
wine /home/eikhren/Downloads/windowsdesktop-runtime-6.0.36-win-x64.exe

# Launch TFC Installer manually
WINEPREFIX=$HOME/.wine-tfc wine "/home/eikhren/Downloads/TFCInstaller/TFCInstaller.exe"

# Copy HD texture mod files into BioShock 2 directory
cp -v /home/eikhren/Downloads/HD\ Texture\ Pack\ v1.0/* /home/eikhren/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/BioShock\ 2\ Remastered/Build/Final/
explanation: The modding process combines Wine-based execution of the TFC Installer and Linux-level file management. Once the HD texture pack files are copied into the BioShock 2 directory, Steam can launch the modded game natively without rerunning the installer.

reusabilityNotes.whenToReuse: Whenever a Windows-only mod installer must be used on Linux systems for games installed through Steam or Lutris, particularly those requiring .NET runtimes or file-level modding.
reusabilityNotes.pitfalls: Avoid running Steam’s file verification afterward, as it may overwrite the modded files. Always back up original assets before replacing them with modded ones.
